alert.note: Alert for San Bernardino (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 25 at 4:39PM PDT by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by moderate to heavy rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of San Bernardino County in Southern California. * WHEN...Until 615 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 435 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated weakening thunderstorms across the area with moderate to heavy rainfall continuing. Though storms are weakening, minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lucerne Valley, Johnson Valley and Hwy 247 Between Lucerne Valley. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
